speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How is't with you, my lord

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Well, my good lady.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Aside

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, hardness to dissemble!--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How do you, Desdemona?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Well, my good lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Give me your hand: this hand is moist, my lady.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It yet hath felt no age nor known no sorrow.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: This argues fruitfulness and liberal heart:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hot, hot, and moist: this hand of yours requires

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A sequester from liberty, fasting and prayer,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Much castigation, exercise devout;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For here's a young and sweating devil here,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That commonly rebels. 'Tis a good hand,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A frank one.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: You may, indeed, say so;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For 'twas that hand that gave away my heart.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A liberal hand: the hearts of old gave hands;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But our new heraldry is hands, not hearts.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I cannot speak of this. Come now, your promise.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What promise, chuck?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have sent to bid Cassio come speak with you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have a salt and sorry rheum offends me;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Lend me thy handkerchief.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Here, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That which I gave you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have it not about me.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, indeed, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That is a fault.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That handkerchief

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Did an Egyptian to my mother give;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She was a charmer, and could almost read

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The thoughts of people: she told her, while

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: she kept it,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Twould make her amiable and subdue my father

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Entirely to her love, but if she lost it

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or made gift of it, my father's eye

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Should hold her loathed and his spirits should hunt

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: After new fancies: she, dying, gave it me;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And bid me, when my fate would have me wive,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To give it her. I did so: and take heed on't;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Make it a darling like your precious eye;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To lose't or give't away were such perdition

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As nothing else could match.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Is't possible?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis true: there's magic in the web of it:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A sibyl, that had number'd in the world

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The sun to course two hundred compasses,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In her prophetic fury sew'd the work;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The worms were hallow'd that did breed the silk;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And it was dyed in mummy which the skilful

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Conserved of maidens' hearts.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Indeed! is't true?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Most veritable; therefore look to't well.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Then would to God that I had never seen't!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ha! wherefore?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why do you speak so startingly and rash?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is't lost? is't gone? speak, is it out

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: o' the way?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Heaven bless us!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Say you?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It is not lost; but what an if it were?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I say, it is not lost.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Fetch't, let me see't.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, so I can, sir, but I will not now.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: This is a trick to put me from my suit:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Pray you, let Cassio be received again.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Fetch me the handkerchief: my mind misgives.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Come, come;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: You'll never meet a more sufficient man.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The handkerchief!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I pray, talk me of Cassio.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The handkerchief!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: A man that all his time

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Hath founded his good fortunes on your love,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Shared dangers with you,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The handkerchief!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: In sooth, you are to blame.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Away!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Is not this man jealous?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I ne'er saw this before.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sure, there's some wonder in this handkerchief:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I am most unhappy in the loss of it.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: 'Tis not a year or two shows us a man:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: They are all but stomachs, and we all but food;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To eat us hungerly, and when they are full,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: They belch us. Look you, Cassio and my husband!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Enter CASSIO and IAGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There is no other way; 'tis she must do't:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, lo, the happiness! go, and importune her.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How now, good Cassio! what's the news with you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Madam, my former suit: I do beseech you

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That by your virtuous means I may again

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Exist, and be a member of his love

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Whom I with all the office of my heart

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Entirely honour: I would not be delay'd.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: If my offence be of such mortal kind

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That nor my service past, nor present sorrows,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Nor purposed merit in futurity,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Can ransom me into his love again,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: But to know so must be my benefit;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: So shall I clothe me in a forced content,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And shut myself up in some other course,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To fortune's alms.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, thrice-gentle Cassio!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My advocation is not now in tune;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord is not my lord; nor should I know him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Were he in favour as in humour alter'd.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: So help me every spirit sanctified,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: As I have spoken for you all my best

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And stood within the blank of his displeasure

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For my free speech! you must awhile be patient:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What I can do I will; and more I will

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Than for myself I dare: let that suffice you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is my lord angry?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He went hence but now,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And certainly in strange unquietness.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Can he be angry? I have seen the cannon,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: When it hath blown his ranks into the air,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, like the devil, from his very arm

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Puff'd his own brother:--and can he be angry?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Something of moment then: I will go meet him:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There's matter in't indeed, if he be angry.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I prithee, do so.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exit IAGO

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Something, sure, of state,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Either from Venice, or some unhatch'd practise

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Made demonstrable here in Cyprus to him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Hath puddled his clear spirit: and in such cases

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Men's natures wrangle with inferior things,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Though great ones are their object. 'Tis even so;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For let our finger ache, and it indues

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Our other healthful members even to that sense

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Of pain: nay, we must think men are not gods,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Nor of them look for such observances

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: As fit the bridal. Beshrew me much, Emilia,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I was, unhandsome warrior as I am,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Arraigning his unkindness with my soul;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But now I find I had suborn'd the witness,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And he's indicted falsely.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Pray heaven it be state-matters, as you think,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And no conception nor no jealous toy

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Concerning you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas the day! I never gave him cause.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But jealous souls will not be answer'd so;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: They are not ever jealous for the cause,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But jealous for they are jealous: 'tis a monster

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Begot upon itself, born on itself.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Heaven keep that monster from Othello's mind!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Lady, amen.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I will go seek him. Cassio, walk hereabout:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If I do find him fit, I'll move your suit

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And seek to effect it to my uttermost.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I humbly thank your ladyship.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Exeunt DESDEMONA and EMILIA

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enter BIANCA

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Save you, friend Cassio!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: What make you from home?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: How is it with you, my most fair Bianca?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I' faith, sweet love, I was coming to your house.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: And I was going to your lodging, Cassio.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: What, keep a week away? seven days and nights?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Eight score eight hours? and lovers' absent hours,

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: More tedious than the dial eight score times?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: O weary reckoning!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Pardon me, Bianca:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I have this while with leaden thoughts been press'd:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: But I shall, in a more continuate time,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Strike off this score of absence. Sweet Bianca,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Giving her DESDEMONA's handkerchief

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Take me this work out.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: O Cassio, whence came this?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: This is some token from a newer friend:

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: To the felt absence now I feel a cause:

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Is't come to this? Well, well.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Go to, woman!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Throw your vile guesses in the devil's teeth,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: From whence you have them. You are jealous now

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That this is from some mistress, some remembrance:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: No, in good troth, Bianca.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Why, whose is it?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I know not, sweet: I found it in my chamber.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I like the work well: ere it be demanded--

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: As like enough it will--I'ld have it copied:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Take it, and do't; and leave me for this time.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Leave you! wherefore?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I do attend here on the general;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And think it no addition, nor my wish,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To have him see me woman'd.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Why, I pray you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Not that I love you not.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: But that you do not love me.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: I pray you, bring me on the way a little,

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: And say if I shall see you soon at night.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Tis but a little way that I can bring you;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: For I attend here: but I'll see you soon.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: 'Tis very good; I must be circumstanced.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: SCENE I. Cyprus. Before the castle.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO and IAGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will you think so?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Think so, Iago!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To kiss in private?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: An unauthorized kiss.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or to be naked with her friend in bed

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: An hour or more, not meaning any harm?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Naked in bed, Iago, and not mean harm!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is hypocrisy against the devil:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: They that mean virtuously, and yet do so,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The devil their virtue tempts, and they tempt heaven.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: So they do nothing, 'tis a venial slip:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But if I give my wife a handkerchief,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What then?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, then, 'tis hers, my lord; and, being hers,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She may, I think, bestow't on any man.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She is protectress of her honour too:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: May she give that?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Her honour is an essence that's not seen;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: They have it very oft that have it not:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But, for the handkerchief,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: By heaven, I would most gladly have forgot it.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thou said'st, it comes o'er my memory,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As doth the raven o'er the infected house,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Boding to all--he had my handkerchief.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ay, what of that?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That's not so good now.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If I had said I had seen him do you wrong?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or heard him say,--as knaves be such abroad,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who having, by their own importunate suit,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or voluntary dotage of some mistress,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Convinced or supplied them, cannot choose

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But they must blab--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hath he said any thing?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He hath, my lord; but be you well assured,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: No more than he'll unswear.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What hath he said?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Faith, that he did--I know not what he did.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What? what?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lie--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With her?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: With her, on her; what you will.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Lie with her! lie on her! We say lie on her, when

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: they belie her. Lie with her! that's fulsome.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: --Handkerchief--confessions--handkerchief!--To

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: confess, and be hanged for his labour;--first, to be

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: hanged, and then to confess.--I tremble at it.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nature would not invest herself in such shadowing

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: passion without some instruction. It is not words

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: that shake me thus. Pish! Noses, ears, and lips.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: --Is't possible?--Confess--handkerchief!--O devil!--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Falls in a trance

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Work on,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My medicine, work! Thus credulous fools are caught;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And many worthy and chaste dames even thus,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: All guiltless, meet reproach. What, ho! my lord!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My lord, I say! Othello!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter CASSIO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How now, Cassio!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: What's the matter?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: My lord is fall'n into an epilepsy:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: This is his second fit; he had one yesterday.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Rub him about the temples.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: No, forbear;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The lethargy must have his quiet course:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If not, he foams at mouth and by and by

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Breaks out to savage madness. Look he stirs:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do you withdraw yourself a little while,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He will recover straight: when he is gone,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I would on great occasion speak with you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit CASSIO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How is it, general? have you not hurt your head?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Dost thou mock me?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I mock you! no, by heaven.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Would you would bear your fortune like a man!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A horned man's a monster and a beast.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There's many a beast then in a populous city,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And many a civil monster.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Did he confess it?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Good sir, be a man;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Think every bearded fellow that's but yoked

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: May draw with you: there's millions now alive

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That nightly lie in those unproper beds

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Which they dare swear peculiar: your case is better.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, 'tis the spite of hell, the fiend's arch-mock,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To lip a wanton in a secure couch,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And to suppose her chaste! No, let me know;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And knowing what I am, I know what she shall be.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, thou art wise; 'tis certain.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Stand you awhile apart;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Confine yourself but in a patient list.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Whilst you were here o'erwhelmed with your grief--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A passion most unsuiting such a man--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cassio came hither: I shifted him away,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And laid good 'scuse upon your ecstasy,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Bade him anon return and here speak with me;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The which he promised. Do but encave yourself,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And mark the fleers, the gibes, and notable scorns,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That dwell in every region of his face;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: For I will make him tell the tale anew,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Where, how, how oft, how long ago, and when

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He hath, and is again to cope your wife:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I say, but mark his gesture. Marry, patience;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or I shall say you are all in all in spleen,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And nothing of a man.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Dost thou hear, Iago?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will be found most cunning in my patience;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But--dost thou hear?--most bloody.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That's not amiss;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: But yet keep time in all. Will you withdraw?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: OTHELLO retires

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Now will I question Cassio of Bianca,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A housewife that by selling her desires

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Buys herself bread and clothes: it is a creature

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That dotes on Cassio; as 'tis the strumpet's plague

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To beguile many and be beguiled by one:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He, when he hears of her, cannot refrain

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: From the excess of laughter. Here he comes:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Re-enter CASSIO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As he shall smile, Othello shall go mad;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And his unbookish jealousy must construe

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Poor Cassio's smiles, gestures and light behavior,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Quite in the wrong. How do you now, lieutenant?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: The worser that you give me the addition

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Whose want even kills me.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ply Desdemona well, and you are sure on't.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Speaking lower

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Now, if this suit lay in Bianco's power,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How quickly should you speed!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Alas, poor caitiff!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Look, how he laughs already!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I never knew woman love man so.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Alas, poor rogue! I think, i' faith, she loves me.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Now he denies it faintly, and laughs it out.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do you hear, Cassio?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Now he importunes him

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To tell it o'er: go to; well said, well said.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She gives it out that you shall marry hey:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do you intend it?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Ha, ha, ha!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Do you triumph, Roman? do you triumph?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I marry her! what? a customer! Prithee, bear some

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: charity to my wit: do not think it so unwholesome.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Ha, ha, ha!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: So, so, so, so: they laugh that win.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Faith, the cry goes that you shall marry her.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Prithee, say true.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am a very villain else.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Have you scored me? Well.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: This is the monkey's own giving out: she is

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: persuaded I will marry her, out of her own love and

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: flattery, not out of my promise.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Iago beckons me; now he begins the story.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: She was here even now; she haunts me in every place.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I was the other day talking on the sea-bank with

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: certain Venetians; and thither comes the bauble,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: and, by this hand, she falls me thus about my neck--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Crying 'O dear Cassio!' as it were: his gesture

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: imports it.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: So hangs, and lolls, and weeps upon me; so hales,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: and pulls me: ha, ha, ha!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Now he tells how she plucked him to my chamber. O,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I see that nose of yours, but not that dog I shall

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: throw it to.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Well, I must leave her company.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Before me! look, where she comes.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Tis such another fitchew! marry a perfumed one.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enter BIANCA

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: What do you mean by this haunting of me?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Let the devil and his dam haunt you! What did you

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: mean by that same handkerchief you gave me even now?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: I was a fine fool to take it. I must take out the

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: work?--A likely piece of work, that you should find

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: it in your chamber, and not know who left it there!

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: This is some minx's token, and I must take out the

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: work? There; give it your hobby-horse: wheresoever

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: you had it, I'll take out no work on't.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: How now, my sweet Bianca! how now! how now!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: By heaven, that should be my handkerchief!

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: An you'll come to supper to-night, you may; an you

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: will not, come when you are next prepared for.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: After her, after her.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Faith, I must; she'll rail in the street else.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will you sup there?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Faith, I intend so.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Well, I may chance to see you; for I would very fain

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: speak with you.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Prithee, come; will you?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Go to; say no more.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exit CASSIO

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: [Advancing]  How shall I murder him, Iago?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Did you perceive how he laughed at his vice?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O Iago!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And did you see the handkerchief?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Was that mine?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Yours by this hand: and to see how he prizes the

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: foolish woman your wife! she gave it him, and he

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: hath given it his whore.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I would have him nine years a-killing.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A fine woman! a fair woman! a sweet woman!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, you must forget that.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay, let her rot, and perish, and be damned to-night;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: for she shall not live: no, my heart is turned to

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: stone; I strike it, and it hurts my hand. O, the

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: world hath not a sweeter creature: she might lie by

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: an emperor's side and command him tasks.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, that's not your way.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hang her! I do but say what she is: so delicate

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: with her needle: an admirable musician: O! she

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: will sing the savageness out of a bear: of so high

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: and plenteous wit and invention:--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: She's the worse for all this.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, a thousand thousand times: and then, of so

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: gentle a condition!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ay, too gentle.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nay, that's certain: but yet the pity of it, Iago!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O Iago, the pity of it, Iago!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: If you are so fond over her iniquity, give her

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: patent to offend; for, if it touch not you, it comes

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: near nobody.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I will chop her into messes: cuckold me!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, 'tis foul in her.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With mine officer!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That's fouler.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Get me some poison, Iago; this night: I'll not

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: expostulate with her, lest her body and beauty

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: unprovide my mind again: this night, Iago.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do it not with poison, strangle her in her bed, even

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: the bed she hath contaminated.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Good, good: the justice of it pleases: very good.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And for Cassio, let me be his undertaker: you

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: shall hear more by midnight.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Excellent good.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A trumpet within

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What trumpet is that same?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Something from Venice, sure. 'Tis Lodovico

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Come from the duke: and, see, your wife is with him.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter LODOVICO, DESDEMONA, and Attendants

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Save you, worthy general!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: With all my heart, sir.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: The duke and senators of Venice greet you.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Gives him a letter

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I kiss the instrument of their pleasures.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Opens the letter, and reads

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And what's the news, good cousin Lodovico?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I am very glad to see you, signior

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Welcome to Cyprus.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: I thank you. How does Lieutenant Cassio?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lives, sir.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Cousin, there's fall'n between him and my lord

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: An unkind breach: but you shall make all well.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Are you sure of that?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: [Reads]  'This fail you not to do, as you will--'

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: He did not call; he's busy in the paper.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Is there division 'twixt my lord and Cassio?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: A most unhappy one: I would do much

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To atone them, for the love I bear to Cassio.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Fire and brimstone!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Are you wise?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What, is he angry?

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: May be the letter moved him;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: For, as I think, they do command him home,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Deputing Cassio in his government.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Trust me, I am glad on't.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Indeed!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I am glad to see you mad.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, sweet Othello,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: [Striking her]  Devil!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have not deserved this.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: My lord, this would not be believed in Venice,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Though I should swear I saw't: 'tis very much:

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Make her amends; she weeps.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O devil, devil!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If that the earth could teem with woman's tears,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Each drop she falls would prove a crocodile.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Out of my sight!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I will not stay to offend you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Going

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Truly, an obedient lady:

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: I do beseech your lordship, call her back.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Mistress!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What would you with her, sir?

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Who, I, my lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay; you did wish that I would make her turn:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Sir, she can turn, and turn, and yet go on,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And turn again; and she can weep, sir, weep;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And she's obedient, as you say, obedient,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Very obedient. Proceed you in your tears.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Concerning this, sir,--O  well-painted passion!--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I am commanded home. Get you away;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I'll send for you anon. Sir, I obey the mandate,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And will return to Venice. Hence, avaunt!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit DESDEMONA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Cassio shall have my place. And, sir, tonight,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I do entreat that we may sup together:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You are welcome, sir, to Cyprus.--Goats and monkeys!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Is this the noble Moor whom our full senate

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Call all in all sufficient? Is this the nature

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Whom passion could not shake? whose solid virtue

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: The shot of accident, nor dart of chance,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Could neither graze nor pierce?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He is much changed.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Are his wits safe? is he not light of brain?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He's that he is: I may not breathe my censure

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What he might be: if what he might he is not,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I would to heaven he were!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: What, strike his wife!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Faith, that was not so well; yet would I knew

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That stroke would prove the worst!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Is it his use?

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Or did the letters work upon his blood,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: And new-create this fault?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Alas, alas!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It is not honesty in me to speak

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What I have seen and known. You shall observe him,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And his own courses will denote him so

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That I may save my speech: do but go after,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And mark how he continues.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: I am sorry that I am deceived in him.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: SCENE II. A room in the castle.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO and EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You have seen nothing then?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Nor ever heard, nor ever did suspect.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yes, you have seen Cassio and she together.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But then I saw no harm, and then I heard

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Each syllable that breath made up between them.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What, did they never whisper?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Never, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor send you out o' the way?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Never.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To fetch her fan, her gloves, her mask, nor nothing?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Never, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That's strange.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I durst, my lord, to wager she is honest,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Lay down my soul at stake: if you think other,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Remove your thought; it doth abuse your bosom.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: If any wretch have put this in your head,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Let heaven requite it with the serpent's curse!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: For, if she be not honest, chaste, and true,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: There's no man happy; the purest of their wives

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Is foul as slander.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Bid her come hither: go.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She says enough; yet she's a simple bawd

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That cannot say as much. This is a subtle whore,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A closet lock and key of villanous secrets

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And yet she'll kneel and pray; I have seen her do't.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Enter DESDEMONA with EMILIA

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord, what is your will?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Pray, chuck, come hither.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What is your pleasure?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let me see your eyes;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Look in my face.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What horrible fancy's this?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: [To EMILIA]  Some of your function, mistress;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Leave procreants alone and shut the door;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Cough, or cry 'hem,' if any body come:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Your mystery, your mystery: nay, dispatch.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit EMILIA

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Upon my knees, what doth your speech import?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I understand a fury in your words.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But not the words.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Why, what art thou?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Your wife, my lord; your true

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And loyal wife.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Come, swear it, damn thyself

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Lest, being like one of heaven, the devils themselves

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Should fear to seize thee: therefore be double damn'd:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Swear thou art honest.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Heaven doth truly know it.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Heaven truly knows that thou art false as hell.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To whom, my lord? with whom? how am I false?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O Desdemona! away! away! away!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas the heavy day! Why do you weep?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Am I the motive of these tears, my lord?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If haply you my father do suspect

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: An instrument of this your calling back,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Lay not your blame on me: If you have lost him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, I have lost him too.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Had it pleased heaven

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To try me with affliction; had they rain'd

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: All kinds of sores and shames on my bare head.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Steep'd me in poverty to the very lips,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Given to captivity me and my utmost hopes,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I should have found in some place of my soul

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A drop of patience: but, alas, to make me

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A fixed figure for the time of scorn

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To point his slow unmoving finger at!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yet could I bear that too; well, very well:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But there, where I have garner'd up my heart,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Where either I must live, or bear no life;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The fountain from the which my current runs,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or else dries up; to be discarded thence!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or keep it as a cistern for foul toads

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To knot and gender in! Turn thy complexion there,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Patience, thou young and rose-lipp'd cherubin,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay, there, look grim as hell!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I hope my noble lord esteems me honest.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, ay; as summer flies are in the shambles,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That quicken even with blowing. O thou weed,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Who art so lovely fair and smell'st so sweet

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That the sense aches at thee, would thou hadst

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: ne'er been born!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, what ignorant sin have I committed?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Was this fair paper, this most goodly book,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Made to write 'whore' upon? What committed!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Committed! O thou public commoner!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I should make very forges of my cheeks,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That would to cinders burn up modesty,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Did I but speak thy deeds. What committed!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Heaven stops the nose at it and the moon winks,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The bawdy wind that kisses all it meets

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is hush'd within the hollow mine of earth,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And will not hear it. What committed!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Impudent strumpet!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: By heaven, you do me wrong.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Are you not a strumpet?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, as I am a Christian:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If to preserve this vessel for my lord

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: From any other foul unlawful touch

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Be not to be a strumpet, I am none.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What, not a whore?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, as I shall be saved.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is't possible?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O, heaven forgive us!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I cry you mercy, then:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I took you for that cunning whore of Venice

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That married with Othello.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Raising his voice

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You, mistress,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That have the office opposite to Saint Peter,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And keep the gate of hell!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Re-enter EMILIA

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: You, you, ay, you!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: We have done our course; there's money for your pains:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I pray you, turn the key and keep our counsel.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Alas, what does this gentleman conceive?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: How do you, madam? how do you, my good lady?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: 'Faith, half asleep.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Good madam, what's the matter with my lord?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: With who?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why, with my lord, madam.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Who is thy lord?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He that is yours, sweet lady.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have none: do not talk to me, Emilia;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I cannot weep; nor answer have I none,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But what should go by water. Prithee, tonight

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Lay on my bed my wedding sheets: remember;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And call thy husband hither.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Here's a change indeed!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: 'Tis meet I should be used so, very meet.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How have I been behaved, that he might stick

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: The small'st opinion on my least misuse?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Re-enter EMILIA with IAGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What is your pleasure, madam?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How is't with you?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I cannot tell. Those that do teach young babes

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Do it with gentle means and easy tasks:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He might have chid me so; for, in good faith,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I am a child to chiding.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What's the matter, lady?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Alas, Iago, my lord hath so bewhored her.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Thrown such despite and heavy terms upon her,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: As true hearts cannot bear.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Am I that name, Iago?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What name, fair lady?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Such as she says my lord did say I was.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He call'd her whore: a beggar in his drink

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Could not have laid such terms upon his callat.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why did he so?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I do not know; I am sure I am none such.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do not weep, do not weep. Alas the day!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Hath she forsook so many noble matches,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Her father and her country and her friends,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To be call'd whore? would it not make one weep?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It is my wretched fortune.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Beshrew him for't!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How comes this trick upon him?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Nay, heaven doth know.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I will be hang'd, if some eternal villain,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Some busy and insinuating rogue,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Some cogging, cozening slave, to get some office,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Have not devised this slander; I'll be hang'd else.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Fie, there is no such man; it is impossible.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If any such there be, heaven pardon him!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: A halter pardon him! and hell gnaw his bones!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why should he call her whore? who keeps her company?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: What place? what time? what form? what likelihood?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: The Moor's abused by some most villanous knave,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Some base notorious knave, some scurvy fellow.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O heaven, that such companions thou'ldst unfold,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And put in every honest hand a whip

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To lash the rascals naked through the world

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Even from the east to the west!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Speak within door.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: O, fie upon them! Some such squire he was

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: That turn'd your wit the seamy side without,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And made you to suspect me with the Moor.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You are a fool; go to.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: O good Iago,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What shall I do to win my lord again?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Good friend, go to him; for, by this light of heaven,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I know not how I lost him. Here I kneel:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If e'er my will did trespass 'gainst his love,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Either in discourse of thought or actual deed,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Or that mine eyes, mine ears, or any sense,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Delighted them in any other form;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Or that I do not yet, and ever did.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And ever will--though he do shake me off

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To beggarly divorcement--love him dearly,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Comfort forswear me! Unkindness may do much;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And his unkindness may defeat my life,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But never taint my love. I cannot say 'whore:'

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It does abhor me now I speak the word;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To do the act that might the addition earn

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Not the world's mass of vanity could make me.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I pray you, be content; 'tis but his humour:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The business of the state does him offence,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And he does chide with you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If 'twere no other--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: 'Tis but so, I warrant.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Trumpets within

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Hark, how these instruments summon to supper!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: The messengers of Venice stay the meat;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Go in, and weep not; all things shall be well.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exeunt DESDEMONA and EMILIA

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter RODERIGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How now, Roderigo!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I do not find that thou dealest justly with me.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What in the contrary?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Every day thou daffest me with some device, Iago;

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: and rather, as it seems to me now, keepest from me

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: all conveniency than suppliest me with the least

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: advantage of hope. I will indeed no longer endure

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: it, nor am I yet persuaded to put up in peace what

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: already I have foolishly suffered.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will you hear me, Roderigo?

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: 'Faith, I have heard too much, for your words and

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: performances are no kin together.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You charge me most unjustly.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: With nought but truth. I have wasted myself out of

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: my means. The jewels you have had from me to

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: deliver to Desdemona would half have corrupted a

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: votarist: you have told me she hath received them

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: and returned me expectations and comforts of sudden

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: respect and acquaintance, but I find none.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Well; go to; very well.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Very well! go to! I cannot go to, man; nor 'tis

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: not very well: nay, I think it is scurvy, and begin

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: to find myself fobbed in it.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Very well.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I tell you 'tis not very well. I will make myself

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: known to Desdemona: if she will return me my

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: jewels, I will give over my suit and repent my

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: unlawful solicitation; if not, assure yourself I

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: will seek satisfaction of you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: You have said now.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Ay, and said nothing but what I protest intendment of doing.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, now I see there's mettle in thee, and even from

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: this instant to build on thee a better opinion than

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: ever before. Give me thy hand, Roderigo: thou hast

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: taken against me a most just exception; but yet, I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: protest, I have dealt most directly in thy affair.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: It hath not appeared.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I grant indeed it hath not appeared, and your

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: suspicion is not without wit and judgment. But,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Roderigo, if thou hast that in thee indeed, which I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: have greater reason to believe now than ever, I mean

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: purpose, courage and valour, this night show it: if

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: thou the next night following enjoy not Desdemona,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: take me from this world with treachery and devise

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: engines for my life.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Well, what is it? is it within reason and compass?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Sir, there is especial commission come from Venice

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to depute Cassio in Othello's place.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Is that true? why, then Othello and Desdemona

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: return again to Venice.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, no; he goes into Mauritania and takes away with

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: him the fair Desdemona, unless his abode be

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: lingered here by some accident: wherein none can be

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: so determinate as the removing of Cassio.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: How do you mean, removing of him?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Why, by making him uncapable of Othello's place;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: knocking out his brains.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: And that you would have me to do?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Ay, if you dare do yourself a profit and a right.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He sups to-night with a harlotry, and thither will I

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: go to him: he knows not yet of his horrorable

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: fortune. If you will watch his going thence, which

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I will fashion to fall out between twelve and one,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: you may take him at your pleasure: I will be near

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to second your attempt, and he shall fall between

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: us. Come, stand not amazed at it, but go along with

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: me; I will show you such a necessity in his death

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: that you shall think yourself bound to put it on

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: him. It is now high suppertime, and the night grows

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: to waste: about it.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I will hear further reason for this.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And you shall be satisfied.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: SCENE III. Another room In the castle.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO, LODOVICO, DESDEMONA, EMILIA and Attendants

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: I do beseech you, sir, trouble yourself no further.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, pardon me: 'twill do me good to walk.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Madam, good night; I humbly thank your ladyship.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Your honour is most welcome.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Will you walk, sir?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O,--Desdemona,--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Get you to bed on the instant; I will be returned

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: forthwith: dismiss your attendant there: look it be done.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I will, my lord.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exeunt OTHELLO, LODOVICO, and Attendants

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: How goes it now? he looks gentler than he did.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He says he will return incontinent:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He hath commanded me to go to bed,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And bade me to dismiss you.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Dismiss me!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It was his bidding: therefore, good Emilia,.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Give me my nightly wearing, and adieu:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: We must not now displease him.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I would you had never seen him!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: So would not I my love doth so approve him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: That even his stubbornness, his cheques, his frowns--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Prithee, unpin me,--have grace and favour in them.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I have laid those sheets you bade me on the bed.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: All's one. Good faith, how foolish are our minds!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If I do die before thee prithee, shroud me

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: In one of those same sheets.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Come, come you talk.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My mother had a maid call'd Barbara:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: She was in love, and he she loved proved mad

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And did forsake her: she had a song of 'willow;'

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: An old thing 'twas, but it express'd her fortune,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And she died singing it: that song to-night

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Will not go from my mind; I have much to do,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But to go hang my head all at one side,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And sing it like poor Barbara. Prithee, dispatch.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Shall I go fetch your night-gown?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, unpin me here.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: This Lodovico is a proper man.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: A very handsome man.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: He speaks well.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I know a lady in Venice would have walked barefoot

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: to Palestine for a touch of his nether lip.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: [Singing]  The poor soul sat sighing by a sycamore tree,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sing all a green willow:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Her hand on her bosom, her head on her knee,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sing willow, willow, willow:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: The fresh streams ran by her, and murmur'd her moans;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sing willow, willow, willow;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Her salt tears fell from her, and soften'd the stones;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Lay by these:--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Singing

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sing willow, willow, willow;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Prithee, hie thee; he'll come anon:--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Singing

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sing all a green willow must be my garland.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Let nobody blame him; his scorn I approve,-

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Nay, that's not next.--Hark! who is't that knocks?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: It's the wind.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: [Singing]  I call'd my love false love; but what

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: said he then?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sing willow, willow, willow:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If I court moe women, you'll couch with moe men!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: So, get thee gone; good night Ate eyes do itch;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Doth that bode weeping?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: 'Tis neither here nor there.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have heard it said so. O, these men, these men!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Dost thou in conscience think,--tell me, Emilia,--

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: That there be women do abuse their husbands

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: In such gross kind?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: There be some such, no question.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why, would not you?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, by this heavenly light!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Nor I neither by this heavenly light;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I might do't as well i' the dark.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Wouldst thou do such a deed for all the world?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: The world's a huge thing: it is a great price.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: For a small vice.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: In troth, I think thou wouldst not.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: In troth, I think I should; and undo't when I had

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: done. Marry, I would not do such a thing for a

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: joint-ring, nor for measures of lawn, nor for

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: gowns, petticoats, nor caps, nor any petty

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: exhibition; but for the whole world,--why, who would

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: not make her husband a cuckold to make him a

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: monarch? I should venture purgatory for't.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Beshrew me, if I would do such a wrong

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For the whole world.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why the wrong is but a wrong i' the world: and

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: having the world for your labour, tis a wrong in your

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: own world, and you might quickly make it right.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I do not think there is any such woman.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Yes, a dozen; and as many to the vantage as would

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: store the world they played for.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But I do think it is their husbands' faults

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: If wives do fall: say that they slack their duties,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And pour our treasures into foreign laps,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Or else break out in peevish jealousies,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Throwing restraint upon us; or say they strike us,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Or scant our former having in despite;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Why, we have galls, and though we have some grace,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Yet have we some revenge. Let husbands know

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Their wives have sense like them: they see and smell

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And have their palates both for sweet and sour,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: As husbands have. What is it that they do

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: When they change us for others? Is it sport?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I think it is: and doth affection breed it?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I think it doth: is't frailty that thus errs?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: It is so too: and have not we affections,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Desires for sport, and frailty, as men have?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Then let them use us well: else let them know,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: The ills we do, their ills instruct us so.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Good night, good night: heaven me such uses send,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Not to pick bad from bad, but by bad mend!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: SCENE I. Cyprus. A street.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Enter IAGO and RODERIGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Here, stand behind this bulk; straight will he come:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Wear thy good rapier bare, and put it home:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Quick, quick; fear nothing; I'll be at thy elbow:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It makes us, or it mars us; think on that,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And fix most firm thy resolution.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Be near at hand; I may miscarry in't.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Here, at thy hand: be bold, and take thy stand.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Retires

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I have no great devotion to the deed;

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: And yet he hath given me satisfying reasons:

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: 'Tis but a man gone. Forth, my sword: he dies.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I have rubb'd this young quat almost to the sense,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And he grows angry. Now, whether he kill Cassio,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Or Cassio him, or each do kill the other,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Every way makes my gain: live Roderigo,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He calls me to a restitution large

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Of gold and jewels that I bobb'd from him,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: As gifts to Desdemona;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: It must not be: if Cassio do remain,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He hath a daily beauty in his life

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That makes me ugly; and, besides, the Moor

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: May unfold me to him; there stand I in much peril:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: No, he must die. But so: I hear him coming.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter CASSIO

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: I know his gait, 'tis he.--Villain, thou diest!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Makes a pass at CASSIO

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That thrust had been mine enemy indeed,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: But that my coat is better than thou know'st

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I will make proof of thine.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Draws, and wounds RODERIGO

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: O, I am slain!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: IAGO from behind wounds CASSIO in the leg, and exit

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I am maim'd for ever. Help, ho! murder! murder!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Falls

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The voice of Cassio: Iago keeps his word.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: O, villain that I am!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is even so.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: O, help, ho! light! a surgeon!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis he:--O brave Iago, honest and just,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That hast such noble sense of thy friend's wrong!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thou teachest me. Minion, your dear lies dead,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And your unblest fate hies: strumpet, I come.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Forth of my heart those charms, thine eyes, are blotted;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thy bed, lust-stain'd, shall with lust's blood be spotted.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Enter LODOVICO and GRATIANO

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: What, ho! no watch? no passage? murder! murder!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: 'Tis some mischance; the cry is very direful.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: O, help!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Hark!

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: O wretched villain!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Two or three groan: it is a heavy night:

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: These may be counterfeits: let's think't unsafe

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: To come in to the cry without more help.

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: Nobody come? then shall I bleed to death.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Hark!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Re-enter IAGO, with a light

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Here's one comes in his shirt, with light and weapons.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who's there? whose noise is this that ones on murder?

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: We do not know.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Did not you hear a cry?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Here, here! for heaven's sake, help me!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What's the matter?

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: This is Othello's ancient, as I take it.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: The same indeed; a very valiant fellow.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What are you here that cry so grievously?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Iago? O, I am spoil'd, undone by villains!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Give me some help.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O me, lieutenant! what villains have done this?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I think that one of them is hereabout,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And cannot make away.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O treacherous villains!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What are you there? come in, and give some help.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To LODOVICO and GRATIANO

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: O, help me here!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That's one of them.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O murderous slave! O villain!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Stabs RODERIGO

speaker: RODERIGO
text_entry: O damn'd Iago! O inhuman dog!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Kill men i' the dark!--Where be these bloody thieves?--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How silent is this town!--Ho! murder! murder!--

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What may you be? are you of good or evil?

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: As you shall prove us, praise us.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Signior Lodovico?

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: He, sir.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: I cry you mercy. Here's Cassio hurt by villains.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Cassio!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How is't, brother!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: My leg is cut in two.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Marry, heaven forbid!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Light, gentlemen; I'll bind it with my shirt.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter BIANCA

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: What is the matter, ho? who is't that cried?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who is't that cried!

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: O my dear Cassio! my sweet Cassio! O Cassio,

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Cassio, Cassio!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O notable strumpet! Cassio, may you suspect

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Who they should be that have thus many led you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: No.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: I am to find you thus: I have been to seek you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lend me a garter. So. O, for a chair,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To bear him easily hence!

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Alas, he faints! O Cassio, Cassio, Cassio!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Gentlemen all, I do suspect this trash

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To be a party in this injury.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Patience awhile, good Cassio. Come, come;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Lend me a light. Know we this face or no?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Alas my friend and my dear countryman

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Roderigo! no:--yes, sure: O heaven! Roderigo.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: What, of Venice?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Even he, sir; did you know him?

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Know him! ay.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Signior Gratiano? I cry you gentle pardon;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: These bloody accidents must excuse my manners,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That so neglected you.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: I am glad to see you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: How do you, Cassio? O, a chair, a chair!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Roderigo!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He, he 'tis he.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: A chair brought in

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, that's well said; the chair!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Some good man bear him carefully from hence;

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: I'll fetch the general's surgeon.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: To BIANCA

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: For you, mistress,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Save you your labour. He that lies slain

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: here, Cassio,

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Was my dear friend: what malice was between you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: None in the world; nor do I know the man.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: [To BIANCA]  What, look you pale? O, bear him out

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: o' the air.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: CASSIO and RODERIGO are borne off

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Stay you, good gentlemen. Look you pale, mistress?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do you perceive the gastness of her eye?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Nay, if you stare, we shall hear more anon.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Behold her well; I pray you, look upon her:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Do you see, gentlemen? nay, guiltiness will speak,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Though tongues were out of use.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter EMILIA

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: 'Las, what's the matter? what's the matter, husband?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Cassio hath here been set on in the dark

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: By Roderigo and fellows that are scaped:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: He's almost slain, and Roderigo dead.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Alas, good gentleman! alas, good Cassio!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: This is the fruit of whoring. Prithee, Emilia,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Go know of Cassio where he supp'd to-night.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: To BIANCA

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: What, do you shake at that?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: He supp'd at my house; but I therefore shake not.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: O, did he so? I charge you, go with me.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Fie, fie upon thee, strumpet!

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: I am no strumpet; but of life as honest

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: As you that thus abuse me.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: As I! foh! fie upon thee!

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Kind gentlemen, let's go see poor Cassio dress'd.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Come, mistress, you must tell's another tale.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Emilia run you to the citadel,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And tell my lord and lady what hath happ'd.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Will you go on? I pray.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Aside

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: This is the night

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: That either makes me or fordoes me quite.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: SCENE II. A bedchamber in the castle: DESDEMONA in bed asleep;

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: a light burning.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is the cause, it is the cause, my soul,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Let me not name it to you, you chaste stars!--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It is the cause. Yet I'll not shed her blood;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor scar that whiter skin of hers than snow,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And smooth as monumental alabaster.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Yet she must die, else she'll betray more men.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Put out the light, and then put out the light:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If I quench thee, thou flaming minister,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I can again thy former light restore,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Should I repent me: but once put out thy light,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Thou cunning'st pattern of excelling nature,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I know not where is that Promethean heat

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That can thy light relume. When I have pluck'd the rose,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I cannot give it vital growth again.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It must needs wither: I'll smell it on the tree.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Kissing her

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ah balmy breath, that dost almost persuade

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Justice to break her sword! One more, one more.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Be thus when thou art dead, and I will kill thee,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And love thee after. One more, and this the last:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: So sweet was ne'er so fatal. I must weep,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But they are cruel tears: this sorrow's heavenly;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: It strikes where it doth love. She wakes.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Who's there? Othello?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ay. Desdemona.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Will you come to bed, my lord?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Have you pray'd to-night, Desdemona?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Ay, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: If you bethink yourself of any crime

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Unreconciled as yet to heaven and grace,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Solicit for it straight.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, my lord, what do you mean by that?

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Torments will ope your lips.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Well, thou dost best.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Sir, you shall understand what hath befall'n,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Which, as I think, you know not. Here is a letter

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Found in the pocket of the slain Roderigo;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: And here another: the one of them imports

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: The death of Cassio to be undertook

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: By Roderigo.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O villain!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Most heathenish and most gross!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Now here's another discontented paper,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Found in his pocket too; and this, it seems,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Roderigo meant to have sent this damned villain;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: But that belike Iago in the interim

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Came in and satisfied him.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O the pernicious caitiff!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How came you, Cassio, by that handkerchief

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That was my wife's?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I found it in my chamber:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And he himself confess'd but even now

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That there he dropp'd it for a special purpose

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Which wrought to his desire.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O fool! fool! fool!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: There is besides in Roderigo's letter,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: How he upbraids Iago, that he made him

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Brave me upon the watch; whereon it came

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That I was cast: and even but now he spake,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: After long seeming dead, Iago hurt him,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Iago set him on.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: You must forsake this room, and go with us:

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Your power and your command is taken off,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: And Cassio rules in Cyprus. For this slave,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: If there be any cunning cruelty

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: That can torment him much and hold him long,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: It shall be his. You shall close prisoner rest,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Till that the nature of your fault be known

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: To the Venetian state. Come, bring him away.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Soft you; a word or two before you go.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have done the state some service, and they know't.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: No more of that. I pray you, in your letters,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: When you shall these unlucky deeds relate,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Speak of me as I am; nothing extenuate,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Nor set down aught in malice: then must you speak

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of one that loved not wisely but too well;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Of one not easily jealous, but being wrought

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Perplex'd in the extreme; of one whose hand,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Like the base Indian, threw a pearl away

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Richer than all his tribe; of one whose subdued eyes,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Albeit unused to the melting mood,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Drop tears as fast as the Arabian trees

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Their medicinal gum. Set you down this;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And say besides, that in Aleppo once,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Where a malignant and a turban'd Turk

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Beat a Venetian and traduced the state,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I took by the throat the circumcised dog,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And smote him, thus.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Stabs himself

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: O bloody period!

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: All that's spoke is marr'd.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I kiss'd thee ere I kill'd thee: no way but this;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Killing myself, to die upon a kiss.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Falls on the bed, and dies

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: This did I fear, but thought he had no weapon;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: For he was great of heart.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: [To IAGO]  O Spartan dog,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: More fell than anguish, hunger, or the sea!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Look on the tragic loading of this bed;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: This is thy work: the object poisons sight;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Let it be hid. Gratiano, keep the house,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: And seize upon the fortunes of the Moor,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: For they succeed on you. To you, lord governor,

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Remains the censure of this hellish villain;

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: The time, the place, the torture: O, enforce it!

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Myself will straight aboard: and to the state

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: This heavy act with heavy heart relate.

speaker: LODOVICO
text_entry: Exeunt
